titleStmt.title: Antony Hain v. King County. Complaint

bibl.title: Antony Hain v. King County. Complaint
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.ab: Terrority of Washington 3rd Judicial District S.S.
div1.p: In the District Court holding terms at Seattle in King County. In the Matter of the Application of Antony Hain for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
To the Hon. J.R. Lewis, Chief Justice of Washington Terrority and Judge of the 3rd Judicial District therein:
div1.ab: The petition and complaint of Anthony Han respectfully shows:
div1.p: That the said Antony Hain, is unlawfully imprisoned, detained, confined and re- strained of his liberty by L.V. Wyckoff, the Sheriff of King County, at the county jail, in county of King in the Territory of Washington.
That the said imprisonment, detention, confinement and restraint is illegal; and that the illegality thereof consists in this, to wit:

The cause or pretense of the said imprisonment, detention, confinement and restraint is a certain commitment issued by me, Samuel Greene, who is or pretends to be a Justice of the Peace in and for said county, which commitment commits said Antony Hain to the said county jail for six months upon the sentence of said Justice upon a trial before said Justice of said Antony Hain upon a
charge of petit larceny, the said Justice having sentenced said Antony Hain to six months imprisonment of as a punishment for said allegded petit larceny, which sentence, commitment, and all the proceedings thereunder are illegal and void because the said Justice had no jurisdiction to pronounce such sentence and no authority or jurisdiction to enforce the same.

Wherefore your petitioner and complainant prays that a Writ of Habeas Corpus may be granted directed to the said L.V. Wyckoff, sheriff as aforsaid, commanding him to have the body of said Anthony Hain before your honor at a time and place therein to be specified to do and recieve what shall then and there be considered by your Honor concerning said Anthony Hain together with the time and cause of His detention and said Writ and that he the said Han may be restored to his liberty.
div1.ab: Dated October 4th, 1878 Patrick Hain On behalf of said Antony Hain
Territory of Washington County of King S.S.
div1.p:
Patrick Hain on oath says that he is over 21 years of age and is a brother of said Antony Hain
the complainiant named in the foregoing complaint; that affiant has signed said foregoing complaint on behalf of said Antony Hain and now makes this affidavit on behalf of him said Antony Hain, that affiant has heard said forgoing complaint read, knows the contents thereof and believes the cause to be true.
div1.ab: Subscribed and sworn to Patrick Han before me this 4th day of October AD 1878 J.M. Hall Notary Public
Filed Oct 4th 1878 James Jerry Clerk By James H. Andreas Deputy
